g:HTMLPanel.pre: <button ui:field="yuiButtonEl1" data-yui="yuiWidget: 'Button', disabled: true"> the first YUI Button </button>
g:HTMLPanel.p: As you can see we are using a <button> HTML element as the YUI Button's source node. We could also use other elements like <input>, <a> or even <div> and <span>. The button's label can be defined both with the HTML elements text and with the "label" attribute.
For more Button information you can read Button User Guide and Button API Docs.
The following example shows 2 YUI buttons, one Button and one ToggleButton.
YUI Autocomplete source node needs to be a HTML <input> element. Also, for testing purposes, the user can pass autocompletion data as a comma separated string
